name: mr_pete
text: God bless children because they wish to share love and fun and have no sense of the private.

name: sleepyhead
text: today i had a kid go in to a room with his mom while she was havin her pap smear...and she was totally down with it

name: likeiwassaying
text: This is my 4th walk through the archive and you are consistently one of my favorite commenters. I felt you should know this. It is my DECISION.

name: mattylite
text: Wait a minute, he has no way of ever getting any money! Maybe he should commit suicide!

name: pogo
text: He's just readin' it outa that newspaper he's holdin', not ayin' HE wants one.

name: mustakrakesh
text: Perfect since we all know it has the gas milage of an oil fire and it handles like a Best Western.

name: prism
text: 5 for the line "Hello! I am the toilet!"

name: slalvation
text: It is what I would say if I were a toilet.

name: tekende
text: Well, it wouldn't make much sense to say "Hello! I am your new Sony HD DVD player!" now would it?

name: pogo
text: No, but I wish electronic appliances did talk to us.

name: echidnaboy
text:
My DVD player's LCD says "hELLO" and "gOOdbyE" when I turn it on and off.

I suppose it might do the same for other people but I like to think it's just me.

name: rykan
text:
My MP3 player ain't nearly as formal, it just says 'BYE' when I turn it off.

The nerve.

name: boredom_man
text: I have a pretty good way of keeping my personal effects streamlined. If a machine wishes me a good-bye, I assume it wants to commit seppuku and that I should be its second.

name: shutup_shutup
text: My car stereo gives very slow messages whenever anything happens.  When you turn it off it tells you to have a safe trip and enjoy driving.

name: tekende
text: I imagine someone reading the whole message, not watching the road, and getting into a horrible wreck as a result. Five people die.

name: bucklemyshoe
text: Why is it that manners and politeness lead to the most careless deaths.. yet we continue to teach them to our children.  Such a jaded and backward society we live in

name: terriblerobot
text: I once had a CD player in my car that, whenever the battery was disconnected and I would have to re-enter the security code, would tell me to "go play in traffic" if I tried to use it without first giving it the code. It had some brass balls on it, that stereo.

name: theyang
text:
aha now you do:
http://www.apple.com/ipodshuffle/
except it needs to go talk in support group about AIDS

name: gormster
text: Well, Sony backed Blu-ray, so yeah that ain't too likely.

name: woodenteeth
text: Why. Why is Phillipe busting in on Cornelius on the toilet all the time. I suppose the older gents do tend to take a bronze age or two to complete a Movement. Just odds on I guess.

name: kledermans
text: Because he just gets annoyed without getting mean like Lyle or Téodor would.

name: aelindil
text:
There was an 8-year old in my house for many months who would do the same thing. It wasn't that anyone took a long time, it's just that little kids either don't care about privacy or they're terrified that they're going to miss something exciting whenever there's a closed door.

Those are my theories, anyway. They kept me from strangling the little blighter.

name: zapatos
text: He didn't walk in on him this time, he was already there... Waiting.

name: woodenteeth
text: ooohh you're right, chubby for conveying the creepy.

name: spinynorman
text: I've used this before and it gets me so much tail you would not believe it

name: crimson_king
text: In what context could that possibly get you 'tail'? "Hi! I'm Norman. Coincidentally, I am also the toilet!"

name: spinynorman
text: It basically operates along the whole "seeing a lady on the side of the road with car trouble and pull over to help her" attitude. You're there to help in tough and embarassing times. Chicks go bugshit for that stuff.

name: carlyle
text: Spinynorman witnesses a tough and embarrasing time in the opposite sex's bathroom and gets tail for it(?)

name: tekende
text: He's there in the bathroom with them, ready with a Knowing Smile when they need it.

text: I want to and I shouldn't.

text: I want to live in a world run by Phillipe

text: You and your 5-year-old leader would be lunchmeat in about a week, but it would be the best week of your meek lives.
